intro: Aconogonon chaneyi, commonly known as the Chaney's aconogonon, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
